message: Hi Bob, I'm excited to offer you this amazing product for sale. It's a one-of-a-kind item that I think you'll really love. I'm willing to let it go for $150.
I'm interested in the product, but $150 is a bit higher than I was hoping to pay. Would you be willing to consider a price of $120?
I understand you're looking to save some money, but I've got to make a profit. I can meet you in the middle at $135, but that's as low as I'm willing to go.
I appreciate your willingness to meet me in the middle, but $135 is still a bit high for me. Would you be willing to consider a price of $125?
I'm starting to think you're getting a good deal, Bob! I'm willing to come down to $130, but that's as low as I can go. This is my final offer, so think carefully before making your next move.

I appreciate your final offer, but I'm still not comfortable with $130. I'm willing to meet you halfway between $125 and $130, so I'll make a counteroffer of $127.50. This is my final offer, so I hope we can come to an agreement.

I think we've been dancing around this price for a while, Bob! I'm willing to meet you at $127.50, but I'd like to throw in an extra incentive to sweeten the deal. I'll include a free accessory that's worth $20. So, the total value you'll get is $147.50. Is that a deal you can live with?
